title: Practically Perfect in Every Way!
date: Reviewed in the United States on November 15, 2016
style: Size: 1 Fl Oz (Pack of 1)Color: W4 Natural Beige
comment: I absolutely LOVE this foundation! I'm a graphic designer and am fascinated by color theory, so when I saw all the color options and warm/cool/neutral categories, it caught my eye. I'm so glad I made the purchase! I was truly able to get a perfect match (it helps to know your "season" to know which category to go with). AND it costs so much less than all the products I'd been trying out previously (including Cover Girl, Neutrogena, and Maybelline). I think it provides the perfect amount of coverage. It's not too thick, where people can tell you're wearing makeup, but not too thin either, where everything shows through. It gives a wonderful, natural look. I'm acne prone, so on bad days I'll still need to use a little cover-up in addition to this foundation. It has not made my acne any worse. I think what I like about it most is it's "powdery" feel when I rub it in. It's so smooth, and even soft. I don't know how a liquid can be soft, but it somehow is! You'll see what I mean when you try it out for yourself... and you DEFINITELY should!

title: Perfect Match
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2014
style: Size: 1 Fl Oz (Pack of 1)Color: W4 Natural Beige
comment: I always knew this product was on the market but never really bothered to try it. I could have saved myself so much time and money if I would have just tried it out earlier! I could kick myself! After using Revlon Colorstay 110 Ivory for years, I am surprised that L'Oreal's True Match is the perfect foundation for me. The foundation I've been using before was way too pink for my skin but I ignored it, hoping no one would notice. After getting more into makeup, I realized that even the palest person in the world needs a foundation specifically meant for them. True Match has dozens of shades that are sure to suit anyone's skin color, whether it be cool, warm, or neutral. The coverage isn't full, which I would prefer, but it is build-able using a sponge or brush. It is a thinner liquid so it is perfect for blending.The smell is somewhat like a vanilla extract, though others compare it to a paint smell. I personally like it. The only thing I would suggest is to try it out in a store first. I am a cool and the Alabaster was too pink for me, so I got the warm Porcelain. It matches my neck and chest to a T so it looks like I'm not wearing any makeup at all. I wish all makeups were made specifically for undertones and not just the color of skin. This makeup will add a glow and make you look healthy. It is not shiny or a matte finish. It's amazing. Will definitely repurchase!
